column3: utACK fa04f26aa77d2cf746db4a8a43068b7c5c9cd02b\n\nThe change looks good me.

Any reason to use `pop` here instead of `get`? (I don't think so, there's no reason to mutate the structure)\nAlso: `>= 24` might be more robust; it's clearly wrong if more than one verack gets sent, but it shouldn't hang forever in that case.
This is the existing code, so I didn't touch it. I forgot to mention to review with `--ignore-all-space`.\n\nI think it is fine for tests to fail when two veracks are sent.

> This is the existing code, so I didn't touch it.

I was thinking that `.get(key, default)` did not exist in older Python versions but even Python 2.7 [supports](https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/stdtypes.html#dict) it. However, the change comes from this PR https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18866 :-)

Still I think `.pop('verack', 0)` ->`.get('verack', 0)` should work just fine a
